Reviews.Title: Awful- Don't waste your money.
Reviews.Author: Chloe
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. That's all I really have to say. I don't think I've ever had a phone that works this horribly.Before I say anything else, I've had this phone less than a year. Probably 4-5 months.>Turning the phone on.If you want to turn the phone back on, you better be prepared to wait. The touch takes 4-5 seconds to respond to ANYTHING when you turn it on. This includes typing, opening any applications, and literally anything else.Not only does it lag with every single thing once it turns on, if you plan to send a quick message- keep dreaming. When you turn the phone back on, whether you turned it off yourself or the battery died, for the first 10-15 minutes, when you're opening messaging, it will "Initialize" every time. No matter how you do it- Going to the menu, or creating a new message from the home screen. Always initializing for 10-15 minutes. This goes for almost any application, but messaging is specifically the one that takes the longest.>Touch ScreenUnless you have pen cap with you, good luck with the touch screen. It will hardly respond to your finger- you need to have a stylus or even fingernails in order to use it SOMEWHAT easily. In other words, if you're looking for an iPod/iPhone-like (AKA actual) touchscreen, you're in the wrong place.>Mobile WebLet's just say this barely even counts as mobile web-browsing. Most sites are completely jumbled and out-of-order- that is, if they even load. 9 times out of 10, when you're making an attempt to get to a site, the connection fails. Try a connection test? Oh, connection's fine. Continue trying- it'll take you at least 10 tries to get to the site. If you're attempting to log in anywhere, don't expect much. I've had to go through 3 different mobile versions of one site before I was able to log in. Not to mention, it would have been nice if it saved usernames/passwords, but of course not. The loading time for any and all site is awful, the mobile viewing is even worse, and it's just a general frustration.>App StoreJust.. wow. Not much to say here except it's extremely limited with it's apps and horrendously overpriced. Most games are between $5-$8 a month. Including games that are free on Google Play, iTunes, etc. As for limited apps, I hope you're not expecting to get any of the popular games from the iTunes store. I can almost promise you they won't be there- or they'll be horridly priced.>Physical / Cosmetic DurabilitySee that nice, sparkly blue? Hope you don't want it for long. The colouring on it chips away within the first week- Leaving it with the cheap plastic it's made of to be chipped, scratched, dented, you name it. Not that it wasn't that cheaply made in the first place. Also, the touchscreen. I don't think they could have spent less money. It's the cheapest plastic touchscreen you can find on a phone. Within a few weeks of gentle use, the screen is scratched to the point where it's hard to even see it.>AccessoriesDon't expect to find a case, for one. Don't expect to listen to music with it, either. Of all things, there's no headphone jack. There's a music app, but no headphones. Not to mention, the speakers sound awful and are ridiculously quiet. Calling it a phone and MP3 player is beyond a load of s***.Just.. Don't do it. Instead, go flush $60 down the toilet. It'll be less of a waste than buying this "phone."

Reviews.Title: Decent phone.
Reviews.Author: Sean Banankhah "Sean the Realtor"
Reviews.Content: This isn't anywhere near smartphone quality but no one should expect that on regular phones. This phone has decent call quality, its surprisingly  sturdy since I dropped it on cement on a 2 story building and it worked fine afterward. Has a microSD card slot. Can watch 3gp format videos at 360p and hold music. Battery life is god and lasts a good day with a full charge. This is a great phone if  you need a short replacement or just a good regular and small phone.The only con: The camera is pretty awful compared to phones these days- @ 1.3MP it will take pictures but not good ones.

Reviews.Title: Worst cell phone
Reviews.Author: ov76
Reviews.Content: The worst cell phone I have ever had.Instead of scrolling the address list it calls that name where you touch it,or scrols the whole list to the end, non-stop.Tries to connect to a paid service.2 of 3 times when I try to pick a call it drops it.Quality of the camera - a way below mediocre.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Igbazenda Moses Tighil
Reviews.Content: Phone arrived quick.Phone was in perfect conditionPhone was unlocked and works perfectly with my son's T-Mobile line and of course my att&t; line.For some strange reason, Ultra Mobile technical support and i have not succeeded in configuring this phone for picture messaging/internet. Ultra mobile is a new provider, they work on the same network as T-Mobile.Over all, phone is great and seller was great

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: carlos lopez
Reviews.Content: great phone, ive had NO problems with this phone. it came as advertised. very good buy. i would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Basic Phone
Reviews.Author: Jen P
Reviews.Content: For me, this phone works wonderfully. I use it mainly for calls and texting. I am not required to have a media package through AT&T; using this phone, but I could have one if I wanted.  I recommend buying a phone case to protect it as well as the screen protectors.  The battery lasts several days for me and I like the touch screen feature. The key board can sometimes be cumbersome, but overall it gets the job done. The operating systems does seem to hesitate at times. I live in a rural area and get reception in 99% of the places I go. Occasionally, if I am in a large building, the reception is weakened. In conclusion, if you are looking for what I call a "dumb" phone (not a smart phone requiring an expensive media package), this is a great phone for basic communication functionality.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: svaboda
Reviews.Content: I got this for my dad for Christmas.  He had been looking for a not-smart phone with a big screen and this phone is perfect for that.  Shipping was very fast too.

Reviews.Title: alright
Reviews.Author: mvessar
Reviews.Content: Was a used phone so a little wear in the finish was expected. I would have given a five star rating except it was supposed to come with a charger but I received the phone only.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm!
Reviews.Author: Eve B Mayes
Reviews.Content: My old phone died & this one has worked perfectly. Just had to slip my SIM card into the slot & away I go!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Eternity II A597 Unlocked GSM Phone with Touchscreen, Mobile TV
Reviews.Author: Mary j. childers
Reviews.Content: I really heard great things about this cell which is why I ordered it.  It was a gift for a student in Dehli, India, but unfortunately it was stolen and it never reach him.  It was traced and found out that it reached the post office in Dehli, but never seem to have left the post office.  While I did have insurance on the cell it was a disappointment to the student.  Presented them with a gift card instead.  Was so disappointed because it had all the features that the student had asked for and the cost was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: NOT HAPPY
Reviews.Author: Virginia Norman
Reviews.Content: I had this same phone previously and it was great.. I used it till it waspractically  dead. This "new" phone has no signal, drops calls and breaks up. I have to shut it off  and turn it back on to get anything and still nothing.. i can hold the old one next to the new one and the old one still gets more bars... so very dissapointed in this purchase. I even brought it to AT&T; themselves and they said it was just the phone and since I bought it else where I was out of luck.

Reviews.Title: it sucks!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: vannesa tennis
Reviews.Content: it does not sleep when not in use which kills the battery fast....its crappy to have to charge it so often

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Nestor Alfonzo
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased. It is being used by my son. He is quite happy because can enjoy most of the functions he wants to have in a cell phone

Reviews.Title: ink
Reviews.Author: Sara Robinson
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this. Fast shipping. This was also packed up nicely. It is a god phone it came with everything it said it would

Reviews.Title: Samsung Eternity ll A597 Phone
Reviews.Author: Genaro Valadez Acuna
Reviews.Content: Touchscreen defective after only one month of use. Phone would not work. Could not get anything to come up on the screen. Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Cell Phones
Reviews.Author: mareleigh
Reviews.Content: Since cell phones are without doubt a much needed piece of equipment, well here is one which is smaller and thinner than impression, and it has the same size battery. If you don't quite understand what that means, check out the review for one of the other cell phones I have purchased.

Reviews.Title: it works
Reviews.Author: BigPapa
Reviews.Content: I didnt realized it didnt have wifi so i didnt add the data plan. but orther than that this phone is basic

Reviews.Title: Samsung Eternity II
Reviews.Author: Maria Poleo
Reviews.Content: Why did you choose this rating? I loved the very good productWhat you like or dislike it, I can not use it because it is locked by the manufacturer and will not let me change the APNWho do you recommended this product? And I chose this product personamente browsing AMAZON

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
3" Touchscreen; Live Widgets; AT&T; Mobile TV
HTML browser; GPS Navigation; Music Player; 2MP Camera; Video
Facebook; Twitter; YouTube; PicDial
Bluetooth; microSD card slot up to 32GB
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung Eternity II A597 Unlocked GSM Phone with Touchscreen, Mobile TV, Social Networking, 2MP Camera, Video, GPS, Bluetooth, MP3 Player and microSD Slot - Blue
